intro: Ajax telamonius, commonly known as the Telamonian ajax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a mild, aromatic scent. Ajax telamonius prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
